briefdescription.para: HyperbolicPolicy needs to be constructible from a ConfigMap.

detaileddescription.para: Extract a FieldAccessor from U for input fields This must allow reading current timestep fields with getConsState()
Extract a FieldAccessor from U for updated fields This must allow reading/settings fields with get/setConsState()

briefdescription.para: Returns the conservative state at a given cell index in an array.

parameterdescription.para: the type of array where we are looking up
the array in which we are getting the state
the index of the cell

simplesect.para: the conservative state at position iCell in U : U(iCell)

memberdef.argsstring: (const Array_t &U, const CellIndex &iCell, const ConsState &u) const

the State value to store in the array

memberdef.name: riemann_solver

detaileddescription.para: Compute flux at interface using states at both sides of the interface

parameterdescription.para: left state (primitive variables)
right state (primitive variables)
x, y or z direction
PolicyScalarData object for the passage of scalar information

memberdef.argsstring: (PrimState qL, PrimState qC, PrimState qR, real_t dL, real_t dR) const
memberdef.name: compute_slope

memberdef.argsstring: (const Array_t &U, const CellIndex &iCell_boundary, const CellMetaData &metadata) const
memberdef.name: getBoundaryValue

briefdescription.para: Get field values for a cell outside of the simulation domain.

detaileddescription.para: This method is usually called by kernels when trying to access neighbors outside of the simulation domain. Returns the state of a virtual cell outside of the domain. The value returned may be determined by the values inside the domain (e.g. reflecting/absorbing boundary conditions)

parameterdescription.para: array containing conservative variables
cell index outside of the domain (iCell_boundary.is_boundary() must be true)
CellMetaData object allowing for mesh queries on size/position
PolicyScalarData object for the passage of scalar information

simplesect.para: The conservative state defined at the given boundary position

memberdef.argsstring: (const Array_t &U, const CellIndex &iCell_boundary, const PrimState &q_in_reconstructed, const CellMetaData &metadata) const
memberdef.name: getBoundaryFlux

briefdescription.para: Get flux value for a neighboring cell outside of the simulation domain.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when trying to compute the flux with neighbors outside of the simulation domain. Returns the flux at the interface on domain boundary. The value returned may be determined by the values inside the domain (e.g. reflecting/absorbing boundary conditions)

parameterdescription.para: array containing conservative variables
cell index outside of the domain (iCell_boundary.is_boundary() must be true), the cell must have an interface with a cell inside the domain
reconstructed state inside domain at boundary interface
CellMetaData object allowing for mesh queries on size/position
PolicyScalarData object for the passage of scalar information

simplesect.para: The flux at the boundary interface

briefdescription.para: Add a post-processing step after the solver.

detaileddescription.para: This is usually a light sub-grid processing, for example to clean negative values for pressure or density

Interface for HyperbolicPolicy used in Finite Volume solvers to verify that HyperbolicPolicy implements all methods correctly We recommand that you wrap your HyperbolicPolicy implementation in this template interface to check every interface methods
